info.name: URL-Checks
info.description:
StartFragment

RESTful API server that allows authenticated users to monitor URLs, and get detailed uptime reports about their availability, average response time, and total uptime/downtime.  

EndFragme

exec: pm.test("Response has required fields - code, message, token", function () {
pm.test("Code is a non-negative integer", function () {
pm.test("Message is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Token is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Response has required fields - code and errors", function () {
pm.test("Code is a non-zero integer", function () {
pm.test("Errors is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Response time is in an acceptable range", function () {

response.name: Signup

exec: pm.test("Verify message field is not empty", function () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 500ms", function () {
pm.test("Verify that the response body is not empty", function () {
pm.test("Response has the required field - error", function () {
pm.test("Error message is not empty", function () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 500ms", function () {
pm.test("Error message is descriptive and provides useful information", function () {
pm.test("Response has the required fields - code and errors", function () {
pm.test("Code is a non-negative integer", function () {
pm.test("Errors should be a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {

body.raw:
{
    "name": "google check",
    "domain": "google.com",
    "protocol": "HTTPS",
    "path": null,
    "port": null,
    "webhook": null,
    "timeout": 3,
    "interval": 1,
    "threshold": 1,
    "authUsername": null,
    "authPassword": null,
    "httpHeaders":[],
    "assert": 200,
    "tags": [
        "tg1",
        "tg2"
    ],
    "ignoreSSL": false
}

exec: pm.test("Validate the response body has the 'code' field", function () {
pm.test("The response body should have the 'errors' field", function () {
pm.test("The code field is a non-negative integer", function () {
pm.expect(responseData.code).to.be.at.least(0, "The code field should be a non-negative integer");
pm.test("Validate errors field is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("The code field should be equal to 0", function () {
pm.test("Validate the message field is an empty string", function () {
pm.test("Verify that dataList field is present in the response", function () {
pm.test("The dataList field is an array and is empty", function () {
pm.test("Code is a non-negative integer", function () {
pm.test("Message is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Verify that dataList array is empty", function () {
pm.test("Code should be equal to 0", function () {
pm.test("Message is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Response has the required fields", function () {
pm.test("Code is a non-negative integer", function () {
